data.title: Is there a US state that has not been shown/represented on film or TV?
data.meta_description: Obviously, California, Neveda, Texas, Florida, New York, New Jersey, Hawaii, Alaska, Illinois, Michigan, Massachusetts, and Washington D.C. (technically...
data.text:
Re: Is there a US state that has not been shown/represented on film or

True, quite true.

Although, some of those southern and midwestern states tend to blend together...I honestly can't tell the difference between Nebraska and Oklahoma for one thing.

Re: Is there a US state that has not been shown/represented on film or

I found a list. I didn't make it, but it proves every state has been represented:

Alabama: “Big Fish”

Alaska: “Mystery, Alaska”

Arizona: “Raising Arizona”

Arkansas: “Sling Blade”

California: “American Graffiti”

Colorado: “The Shining”

Connecticut: “The Ice Storm”

Delaware: “Dead Poets Society”

District of Columbia: “All the President’s Men”

Florida: “Scarface”

Georgia: “Gone With the Wind”

Hawaii: "Blue Crush"

Idaho: “Napoleon Dynamite”

Illinois: “Ferris Bueller’s Day Off”

Indiana: “Breaking Away”

Iowa: “Field of Dreams”

Kansas: “Paper Moon”

Kentucky: "Stripes"

Louisiana: “The Apostle”

Massachusetts: “Good Will Hunting”

Maine: “The Cider House Rules”

Maryland: “Diner”

Michigan: “Out of Sight”

Minnesota: “Fargo”

Missouri: “Meet Me in St. Louis”

Mississippi: “O Brother Where Art Thou”

Montana: “A River Runs Through It”

Nebraska: “Election”

Nevada: “Casino”

New Hampshire: “Primary Colors”

New Jersey: “On the Waterfront”

New Mexico: "The Tao of Steve"

New York: “The Godfather”

North Carolina: “Bull Durham”

North Dakota: “Leprechaun”

Ohio: “Lolita” (Kubrick version)

Oklahoma: “Oklahoma!”

Oregon: “Stand By Me”

Pennsylvania: “Rocky”

Rhode Island: “Outside Providence”

South Carolina: “Lords of Discipline”

South Dakota: “Badlands”

Tennessee: “Nashville”

Texas: “The Last Picture Show”

Utah: “SLC Punk”

Vermont: “Super Troopers”

Virginia: “Remember the Titans”

Washington: "Say Anything..."

West Virginia: “October Sky”

Wisconsin: “American Movie”

Wyoming: "Close Encounters of the Third Kind"

Re: Is there a US state that has not been shown/represented on film or

Although, some of those southern and midwestern states tend to blend together...I honestly can't tell the difference between Nebraska and Oklahoma for one thing.

Clearly you haven't seen Oklahoma!

Re: Is there a US state that has not been shown/represented on film or

Alabama - Home state in Forrest Gump.

Alaksa - Featured and many movies and TV. Most notable (to me) Northern Exposure.

Arizona - Any movie or show featuring The Grand Canyon

Arkansas - Sling Blade

California - LA, 'nuff said.

Connecticut -

Delaware -

Florida - Plenty.

Georgia - Atlanta is there, plenty of movies featuring Atlanta.

Hawaii - Plenty of movies/shows there.

Idaho - Napoleon Dynamite.

Illinois - Chicago.

Indiana -

Iowa -

Kansas - Leavenworth. The Day After.

Kentucky

Louisianna - New Orleans

Maine -

Maryland - Close to D.C. It's likely any show/movie in D.C. has been in Maryland at some point. Hell, for all intents and purposes D.C. is *in* Maryland.

Massachusetts - Boston. Cheers, to name one.

Michigan - Detroit. Beverly Hills Cop, Robocop.

Minnestoa -

Mississippi -

Missouri - St. Louis. Quite a few movies centered around St. Louis.

Montana - TV Series Coach to name one.

Nebraska -

New Hampshire -

New Jersey - Any movie featuring NYC is bound to mention/go into NJ sooner or later.

New Mexico - I know "Vacation" went here.

New York - New York City

North Carolina -

North Dakota -

Ohio - Cleveland, Major League

Oklahoma - Musical of the same name.

Oregon - IIRC Short Circuit.

Pennsylvania - Philadelphia is here: Rocky.

South Carolina -

South Dakota - Mt. Rushmore. (Plenty of movies featuring this.)

Tennessee -

Texas - Certainly, Dallas anyone?

Utah -

Vermont - TV series "Newhart"

Virginia - The Pentagon is here.

Washington - Seattle.

West Virginia -

Wisconsin - No specific examples I can think of, but I'm sure it has.

Wyoming -

Washington D.C. - 'Nuff said.

Re: Is there a US state that has not been shown/represented on film or

Ah, even I can name some reasonably popular films taking place in Nebraska:

Citizen Ruth, Election, About Schmidt. I'm sure there are others, but those are the ones that spring to mind.
